Package frisbee.puf.backend.controller

Class PlayerController

java.lang.Object
frisbee.puf.backend.controller.PlayerController
@CrossOrigin @RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class PlayerController extends Object

    deletePlayers()

  • Field Details

    • playerService

      @Autowired PlayerService playerService
      The PlayerService instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerController

      public PlayerController()

  • Method Details

    • message

      @RequestMapping("/") public String message()
      This method is called on accessing the backend URL.
      Returns:
      a welcome message

    • getAllPlayers

      @GetMapping("/players") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Player>> getAllPlayers()
      Maps to a GET request on the players endpoint and returns all registered players.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object containing the HTTP status and a list of all Player objects that are stored in the database

    • registerPlayer

      @PostMapping("/players/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity registerPlayer(@RequestBody Player newPlayer)
      Maps to a POST request on the players/register endpoint and passes the submitted Player object to the PlayerService instance in order to save it.
      Parameters:
      newPlayer - the Player object to be registered
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status code and the Player object in case of success, an IllegalArgumentException otherwise

    • loginPlayer

      @PostMapping("/players/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity loginPlayer(@RequestBody Map<String,String> credentials)
      Maps to a POST request on the players/login endpoint and passes the provided credentials to the PlayerService instance in order to validate them and log in the correspondent player.
      Parameters:
      credentials - a map of Strings containing a player email and a password
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status code and the Player object in case of success, an LoginException if the credentials don't match and a NoSuchElementException if no record with the provided email can be found

    • deletePlayers

      @DeleteMapping("/players/delete-all") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deletePlayers()
      Maps to a DELETE request on the players/delete-all endpoint and notifies the PlayerService instance to delete all players from the database.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status code

    • updatePlayerName

      @PutMapping("/players/update-player-name/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updatePlayerName(@PathVariable("email") String email, @RequestBody String newName)
      Maps to a PUT request on the players/update-player-name/{email} endpoint and passes a new name to the PlayerService instance in order to update the corresponding player's name.
      Parameters:
      email - the player's email
      newName - the player's new name
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status code and the Player object in case of success, an IllegalArgumentException otherwise
